event: The mouse is clicking on the "Start" button on the Windows taskbar.
description: The user clicked the "Start" button on the Windows taskbar, causing the "Start" menu to open and display the "Control Panel" option.
outcome: The mouse cursor moved to hover over the "Control Panel" option within the open "Start" menu on the Windows XP desktop.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Control Panel" shortcut in the start menu.
description: The user clicks the "Control Panel" shortcut in the Start menu. As a result, the "Control Panel" tooltip box disappears.
outcome: A tooltip box, previously visible in the sequence, is no longer present in the final frame. The Windows XP Control Panel window opens.

event: The mouse pointer is hovering over the "Appearance and Themes" category icon in the Control Panel.
description: The mouse pointer is moved from the "Appearance and Themes" category icon to the "Display" Control Panel icon.
outcome: The "Appearance and Themes" category is no longer highlighted and the "Display" Control Panel icon is now highlighted, indicating the mouse cursor has moved from the former to the latter.

event: The mouse pointer is clicking on the "Display" Control Panel icon.
description: The user clicks the "Display" Control Panel icon in the "Appearance and Themes" category. As a result, the "Display Properties" window opens.
outcome: The "Display Properties" window, titled "Display Properties", has appeared. The "Themes" tab is active, displaying a preview of the current theme "Windows XP (Modified)". The mouse cursor is hovering over the minimized view of the "Active Window".

event: The mouse is clicking the "Screen Saver" tab in the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicks on the "Screen Saver" tab in the "Display Properties" window. As a result, the  "Display Properties" window changes to now display the options for the "Screen Saver" tab.
outcome: The "Display Properties" window is open, showing the "Screen Saver" tab. The "Windows XP" screensaver is selected with a wait time of 10 minutes, and the "On resume, password protect" option is disabled.

event: The mouse is clicking on the dropdown arrow of the "Screen Saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicks on the dropdown arrow of the "Screen Saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window.  As a result, the dropdown menu expands to reveal a list of screen saver options, with "Windows XP" displayed as the selected option.
outcome: The "Screen Saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window is open, revealing a list of alternative screen saver options. "Windows XP" is still selected.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "[None]" menu item in the "Screen Saver" dropdown menu.
description: The user clicks on the "[None]" menu item within the "Screen Saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window.
outcome: The "Screen Saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window changed to "[None]" from its previous selection, "Windows XP".

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Power" button in the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the highlighted "Power" button within the "Display Properties" window's "Screen Saver" tab. This action opens the "Power Options Properties" window in front of the "Display Properties" window.
outcome: The "Power Options Properties" window, with its "Power Schemes" tab active, appeared in front of the "Display Properties" window. The "Power" button in the background window is no longer highlighted. The newly visible window displays the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme with the "Turn off monitor" option set to "After 20 mins" and all other options set to "Never".

event: The mouse is clicking on the dropdown button to the right of the "System hibernates" option in the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the dropdown menu to the right of the "System hibernates" option within the "Settings for Home/Office Desk power scheme" section. This reveals a list of time options for the "System hibernates" setting.
outcome: The "System hibernates" dropdown menu within the "Power Options Properties" window is now expanded, revealing a list of time options. The "System hibernates" dropdown is selected to "Never".

event: The mouse is clicking on the "After 5 hours" item in the "System hibernates" dropdown menu.
description: The user clicks on the "After 5 hours" item within the "System hibernates" dropdown menu.  As a result, "After 5 hours" is selected within the "System hibernates" dropdown menu.
outcome: The "System hibernates" dropdown menu within the "Power Options Properties" window now displays "After 5 hours" as the selected option.

event: The mouse pointer is clicking the dropdown arrow of the "Power schemes" listbox in the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the dropdown arrow of the "Power schemes" listbox to reveal a list of available power schemes. "Home/Office Desk" is currently selected.
outcome: The "Power Schemes" dropdown menu in the "Power Options Properties" window is now expanded, revealing a list of alternative power scheme options. "Home/Office Desk" is still selected.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Always On" item in the "Power schemes" dropdown menu.
description: The user clicked the "Always On" item within the "Power schemes" dropdown menu. As a result, the power scheme changes to "Always On".
outcome: The "Power Options Properties" window updated to reflect the "Always On" power scheme selection. The "Turn off monitor" setting remains at "After 20 mins", while the "Turn off hard disks", "System standby", and "System hibernates" settings all remain at "Never".

event: The mouse is clicking on the dropdown button for the "Turn off hard disks" setting.
description: The user clicks the dropdown button for the "Turn off hard disks" setting within the "Settings for Always On power scheme" section.
outcome: The "Turn off hard disks" dropdown menu within the "Power Options Properties" window is now expanded, revealing a list of time options. The "Turn off hard disks" dropdown is selected to "Never".

event: The mouse pointer is clicking on the dropdown button of the "Turn off monitor" option in the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the dropdown button of the "Turn off monitor" option within the "Settings for 'Always On' power scheme" section. The dropdown menu expands to display a list of time interval options.
outcome: The "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu within the "Power Options Properties" window has been expanded to reveal a list of time interval options, ranging from "After 1 min" to "Never". "After 20 mins" is currently selected.

event: The mouse is clicking the "Never" item in the  "System hibernates" dropdown menu of the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the "Never" option within the "System hibernates" dropdown menu.
outcome: The "System hibernates" dropdown menu within the "Power Options Properties" window now displays "Never" as the selected option.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Cancel" button of the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the "Cancel" button in the "Power Options Properties" window.  As a result, the "Power Options Properties" window closes.
outcome: The "Power Options Properties" window has been closed. The "Display Properties" window, specifically the "Screen Saver" tab, remains open.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "OK" button of the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the "OK" button at the bottom of the "Display Properties" window.  As a result, the "Display Properties" window closes.
outcome: The "Display Properties" window, specifically the "Screen Saver" tab, was closed and the "Appearance and Themes" window is now visible, displaying various customization options.

event: The mouse is clicking on the close button of the "Appearance and Themes" window.
description: The user clicks the close button in the title bar of the "Appearance and Themes" window.  As a result, the "Appearance and Themes" window closes.
outcome: The "Appearance and Themes" window is no longer present on the Windows XP desktop.
